column5: Any chance I will be able to get the boat in for Easter weekend  thinking about Dalrymple or Balsam for Pike?
No chance, won't be even close. The new target should be Mothers Day weekend, no joke.
auger likely still tool of choice then
I have a trailer on Rymple and I would not be surprised if there is still ice when I open on May 1st
Let me give that some thought for a minute....  If 6 mile and the pool are still this tight.. not a hope in hell.
Awesome pic Wayne.  You should of done a fly by south of here. Might of seen a couple a fellas ya know.LOL
Wayne you let us know when things start opening up. I'm kinda hoping if the Park isn't open by May 5th I can go fish Lakers on the Sound.

Probably my last opportunity to get out on snow... was cold enough this morning to get across the mud (frozen) from hangar to runway that still has 20" of hard packed snow on it. Probably a month+ before I get out again and it will be on floats (I hope!), but who knows the weather man's been wrong MANY times before! lol  ..oh and M or S ...start planning to fish the Sound !
That is what I expected but was hoping I was wrong  now I have no excess to avoid dinner at the in-laws
I just checked the ice on Scugog today.  There was 19 inches in total.  7" of white soft ice on top and 12" of good solid ice under that.
still 30 inches on most parts of sturgeon & pigeon lakes !!!!! no way you are fishing easter weekend.....
